name: SSH
description: This app supports executing various endpoint-based investigative and containment actions on an SSH endpoint

actions.description: Executes a program on the remote machine

command.description: Command to be executed on endpoint

actions.description: Lists all the network connections. Requires root privileges. Requires netstat to be installed
actions.verbose:
Executes the following command
sudo -S netstat -etnp
On OS X the following command is executed instead
sudo -S lsof -nP -i
Note that the name of the command in the output is limited to 9 characters.

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP to list network connections on

actions.description: Add an iptables rule to linux server. Requires root privileges. Not supported on OS X
actions.verbose:
Need to specify either an IP or a port to block.
Executes the following command
sudo -S iptables -I <DIRECTION> -p <PROTOCOL> <IP> <PORT> -j DROP -m <COMMENT>
where the IP and PORT fields will block either source or destination based on the DIRECTION.
Only iptables is supported.

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP to add firewall rule to

remote_port.description: Remote port to block (allows multiple ports)

protocol.description: Protocol to block. tcp, udp, etc

actions.description: Lists the rules in iptables. Requires root privileges. Not supported on OS X
actions.verbose:
Executes the following command
sudo -S iptables -L <CHAIN> --line-numbers -n
Only iptables is supported

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP to list firewall rules on

actions.description: Delete a firewall rule. Requires root privileges. Not supported on OS X
actions.verbose:
Executes the following command
sudo -S iptables -D <CHAIN> <NUMBER>
Only iptables is supported

Executes the following command
sudo -S shutdown -r now

Executes the following command
sudo -S shutdown -h now

actions.description: Logout a user on endpoint (Requires root privileges)

actions.verbose:
Executes the following command
ps c -Ao user,uid,pid,ppid,stime,command

actions.description: Retrieve a file from endpoint and save it to the vault
actions.verbose: File path needs to be a full path. For example, /home/USER/file.tgz instead of ~/file.tgz

file_path.description: Full path to file to download

actions.description: Put a file from the vault to another location
